We're still reflecting on our training in addressing mental health in schoolchildren in January. One of our favorite quotes: "Being resilient doesn't mean you don't have stress-it means you're able to cope with it." We are committed to addressing COVID-related stress on children
Let's hoop:

Children are capable of transmitting the virus yet they aren't superspreaders: COVID-19 is clearly dissimilar to influenza or the common cold virus. "You put one of those in a classroom, then in a few days, it's overrun. That's not what we see with COVID."
Relying on remote learning in times of crisis is not a new phenomenon. In 1937, the Chicago school system used radio to teach children during a polio outbreak.https://t.co/K5idy2vrgO
